definition: state of Wei (c. 1040-209 BC), vassal of Zhou
to defend one's country
surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces
to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet
country/nation/state/national/CL:個|个[ge4]
surname Guo
guard home, defend the country (idiom); national defense

sentences.english: It's the glorious duty for every soldier to defend our country against enemies.
sentences.chinese: 衛國抗敵是每個士兵應盡的光榮職責。

sentences.english: His heart desired this, so he decided to go to Shewei country and learn Buddhism.
sentences.chinese: 他心中十分嚮往，便想去舍衛國觀光並修學佛法。

sentences.english: Marshal Zhukov's contribution to the Great Patriotic War is unparalleled to anyone.
sentences.chinese: 朱可夫元帥爲偉大衛國戰爭勝利做出的貢獻無人能及。

sentences.english: At least the banks would not be holding the whole country hostage.
sentences.chinese: 至少銀行就不能打着保家衛國的旗號，發國難財了。

sentences.english: His first priority was protecting the country.
sentences.chinese: 他的首要任務是保衛國家。

sentences.english: After the Great Patriotic War, the Soviet Union's nuclear fission research have no news.
sentences.chinese: 衛國戰爭爆發後，蘇聯核裂變研究陷入停滯。

sentences.english: But he that stands by it now, deserves the love and thanks of every man and woman.
sentences.chinese: 但真正挺身以衛國者，值得天下男女的愛及感謝。

sentences.english: In the state of Wei, he was besieged and almost killed since he was regarded mistakenly as Yanghu.
sentences.chinese: 在衛國，被人誤認爲陽虎而遭困，差點兒丟了老命。

sentences.english: The protection of the country is the sacred duty of every citizen.
sentences.chinese: 保衛國家是每個公民的神聖職責。

sentences.english: What Confucius said couldn't dissuade Yanhui yet. He went on saying, "I will be upright inside and deferential outside."
sentences.chinese: 顏回要去衛國的決心並沒有因爲老師這一席話而打消。

sentences.english: Your charge now is not only to protect our country, but to do what is right and just.
sentences.chinese: 你們的使命不僅是保家衛國，更是伸張正義。

sentences.english: They made a promise to our country to be its defenders.
sentences.chinese: 他們在保家衛國上做出許諾。

sentences.english: Women now have the ability to fight crime and defend their countries in war.
sentences.chinese: 女性如今有能力打擊犯罪，更能在戰時保家衛國。

sentences.english: Yao Weiguo of the "hope that the Morning", the entire screen is Pianleng gray tone.
sentences.chinese: 姚衛國的《希望的早晨》，整個畫面是偏冷灰調子。

sentences.english: Some officials from Wei made a special trip to Chen to kill the two men.
sentences.chinese: 衛國的大臣特地到陳國去執法處死這兩個人。

sentences.english: This is what the military leaders, charged with responsibility for our strategic  deterrent, need in order to defend our country.
sentences.chinese: 這是肩負戰略威懾職責的軍事領袖們保家衛國的需要。

definition: Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)
to die in battle (idiom)
Song of the Southern dynasties 南朝宋 (420-479), with capital at Nanjing
to besiege
to engage in wars of aggression at will (idiom)/militaristic/bellicose
to praise
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
Duke Wen of Jin (697-628 BC, reigned 636-628 BC), one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
high-ranking military officer
White Lotus society
Kaesong or Gaeseong city in southwest North Korea, close to the border with South Korea and a special economic zone for South Korean companies
to travel around many countries (idiom); peregrinations/refers to the travels of Confucius
vassal state
expeditionary force/army on a distant expedition
punitive expedition to the east
fight
